data.title: Good place for homeless
data.text: Saw a lot of homeless people sleeping on the lawn and walking around. Parking was limited. Pictures show Bayfront but are inaccurate and that's not this park. Only good thing is there is a lot of shade at this park.

data.title: Friendship Park Chula Vista.
data.text: I the past I was a groomsman in a Wedding that had the Bridal party Portrait shot at this park. It is close to Downtown Chula Vista and it is a peaceful park perfect for a jog or a walk with the Dog.

data.title: Next to Library, sweet retreat with trees.
data.text: We always enjoy this park either before or after the library.  Not many benches and no picnic tables, but tons of trees and small hills for children's imagination.  No playground here.

data.title: Beautiful, Inspirational, Walkable Friendship Park
data.text: As I walked through this gorgeous gem of a park with beautiful pines and winding paths, I was reminded of our neighbors to the south by an El Camino Real Trail bell monument announcing miles to the closest missions.  In addition, to this mission monument the park displays a memorial statue of Will T Hyde past Mayor, Teacher and Community Activist.  After enjoying the inspirational walk through the park, I strolled inside the library and viewed a photographic history of Chula Vista in the main entrance. Remember your smart phone for photos and walking shoes.....even a picnic lunch.
